definition: quick fix/opportune short cut (around a difficulty)/cheap trick (to get what one wants)/to pull a fast one
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
opportunely/coincidentally/as it happens/skillful/timely
to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks

sentences.english: This led to corner cutting and-with surprising frequency-falsification of data.
sentences.chinese: 其结果导致投机取巧了，伪造数据资料，其。

sentences.english: Besides, change according to changing circumstances and fluke mind exists in the majority of people.
sentences.chinese: 此外，投机取巧和侥幸心理大多数人都有这种心理。

sentences.english: But many have found a way around that.
sentences.chinese: 但是许多药店还是找到取巧的办法。

sentences.english: A gimmicky or imbalanced team relies on one powerful tactic to win.
sentences.chinese: 投机取巧的团队依靠单一的强力战术制胜。

sentences.english: No playing safe, no playing to gallery, my ideal Chopin.
sentences.chinese: 不打安全牌，不取巧讨好，我的理想萧邦。

sentences.english: He wants no members in his political party who are lust along for the ride.
sentences.chinese: 他不想让投机取巧者在他的政党里。

sentences.english: Because you can't cheat by using cognates.
sentences.chinese: 因为你不能取巧使用同根词。

definition: to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
to win by a surprise move
fancy
brute force
cunning/dexterous/ingenious
avoiding doing something that one is clumsy at to save face
diversionary tactic/smokescreen
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
dishonest practices
(fig.) to fight a one-sided battle/to have an unfair advantage in a contest
clever-clever/clever in trivial matters/sharp but petty-minded
shallow/superficial
to conspire openly/overt plot
lit. devil's gate, crooked path (idiom); corrupt practices/crooked methods/dishonesty
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
